result.execSummary:
The defendant Christian B. Greenup was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Christian B. Greenup was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christian B. Greenup is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Christian B. Greenup was found guilty of 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
*Pay costs 
*25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
*Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

*Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  J.A.Y. her home, school, work or any other place she frequents 
*Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
*May not work in any occupation that contains children 
*Complete a psycho sexual evaluation and if any treatment recommendations will need to comply 
*Provide agent with authorization so agent can review any prescriptions

#P1 verification of time served by Crystal Salinas in the Waupaca County Jail

Defendant Christian B. Greenup in court with attorney Philip J. Brehm. Defendant Christian B. Greenup in custody. Ryan Wetzsteon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Hearing today is for a Motion to Re-open.
2:01 p.m.  Exhibit #1 is marked for ADA Wetzsteon.

2:05 p.m.  Case is called and appearances are stated.

Atty Brehm makes statements on the record regarding stipulation of time that Crystal Salina had been spent in the Waupaca County Jail.
Atty Wetzsteon would agree to the stipulation and states this on the record.
2:07 p.m.  Exhibit #1 is referenced.
Atty Brehm would ask for 30 days for the State to file a brief.
Atty Brehm would then reply within 2 weeks after the receipt of the brief from the State.
Atty Brehm would like to update his brief and can have it done within 3 weeks.
State indicates that they can respond within 30 days.
Atty Brehm will then have an additional 15 days to respond to the Brief of the State.

BY THE COURT:
Court approves the stipulation between the parties with regards to Crystal Salinas.
Atty Brehm to file his updated brief within 3 weeks from today's date.
State to have 30 days to respond to the brief of the defense.
Atty Brehm will then have 15 days to reply to the State's Brief.

Request to Extend Motion Deadline filed by the State
Affidavit of Daniel Hess

Exhibit D#1 - Group of 4 Transcripts
   Exhibit D#2 - Private Investigator notes
   Exhibit D#3 - Transcript of Audio Interview 06-03-15
   Exhibit D#4 -  Transcript of Audio Interview 06-04-15

Defendant Christian B. Greenup in court with attorney Philip J. Brehm. Defendant Christian B. Greenup in custody. Daniel R. Hess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:27 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Motions have been filed.
Court reviews the file.

Atty Hess addresses the Court, requests a sequestration throughout the hearing. 
Atty Brehm concurs. 

BY THE COURT:
Court grants sequestration.

Atty Hess addresses the Court as to motion filed.
Atty Brehm addresses the Court, replies.

Court addresses the parties as to cases referenced on the record.
There are two limited exceptions to Juror testimony, addressed on the record.
Atty Brehm replies.
Discussions continue between Court and Defense.

Atty Hess addresses the Court.

Court replies as to decision. 

Atty Brehm states the names of the Jurors that were sequestered, will release the Jurors at this time.

1:48 PM J.Y. is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Brehm.
1:53 PM Cross-examination by Atty Hess.
1:53 PM Witness is excused from his subpoena.

1:54 PM P.J. is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Brehm.
Exhibits #1-#2 are marked on behalf of Defense.
BY THE COURT: Exhibits are offered and received.
2:02 PM Cross-examination by Atty Hess.
2:03 PM Re-direct by Atty Brehm.

2:05 PM M.H. is called by telephone, is sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Brehm.
2:09 PM Defendant is waiving any attorney/client confidentiality at this time.
2:44 PM Cross-examination by Atty Hess.
2:56 PM Re-direct by Atty Brehm.
2:57 PM Testimony is concluded with this witness.

Atty Brehm addresses the Court regarding two transcripts.
Atty Hess replies to the transcripts.            
Atty Brehm should have a period of time to object.

BY THE COURT:
Today's transcript will be prepared.
Parties will then receive 30 days after that for any written brief, if the intention is to supply anything further for the Court's determination.

Exhibits #3-#4 are marked on behalf of Defense.
Court will withhold ruling marking the exhibits into evidence.

3:02 PM Court will take a recess at this time.

3:21 PM Court is back in session.

Atty Brehm addresses the Court, refers to Exhibit #2.
C.S. was properly subpoenaed for today but she is not present.

Court is prepared to wait for the next witness. 

Atty Hess addresses the Court.  

Court is not prepared to decide the issue at this point. 

Atty Hess does not have the ability to cross examine C.S.

Discussions continue.

BY THE COURT:
Court has conditionally received Exhibit #2, pending determination by the Court.

3:30 PM Court will take 10 minutes for the State to look further into this issue.

3:51 PM Court is back on the record.

Atty Hess objects to Exhibit #2 for reasons stated on the record.
Atty Brehm addresses the Court, replies.

3:52 PM Witness has just arrived.

3:53 PM C.S. is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Brehm.
3:58 PM Cross-examination by Atty Hess.
4:00 PM Re-direct by Atty Brehm.

Court will decide this case orally or written.

4:01 PM Court is in recess.

Count 1:  Prison with Extended Supervision

Defendant Christian B. Greenup in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Defendant Christian B. Greenup in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:40 p.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Court and counsel have received their copies of the PSI.
Court questions if any corrections need to be made on the record.
Prosecutor argues regarding sentencing.
Atty Constable would request that the Court review the victim impact statements. 
Court takes a moment to read.
1:52 p.m.  Atty Constable continues her argument regarding sentencing.
Court asks the parties if there were any corrections or changes on the PSI,
Atty Constable indicates on page 8 there is a typo and states this on the record.
Atty Constable indicated no changes to the Sex Offender Evaluation Report.
Atty Kryshak indicated that he found the same error as Atty Constable.
1:56 p.m.  Attorney for Defendant argues regarding sentencing.
1:58 p.m.  Defendant reads a statement on his behalf.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Sentenced to prison:
**168 months of initial confinement
**120 months extended supervision
Jail credit of 363 days
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  J.A.Y. her home, school, work or any other place she frequents
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Pay costs
Register with the Sex Offender Registry Program
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
May not work in any occupation that contains children.
Complete a psycho sexual evaluation and if any treatment recommendations will need to comply
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Provide agent with authorization so agent can review any prescriptions.
Do not possess firearms

20 days to appeal

    Letter from Defendant
Atty Gary Kryshak appointed
Sentencing hearing on August 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Atty Gary Kryshak appointed

(emailed report 8/4/16-kp)

Day 3 of Jury Trial:
Defendant Christian B. Greenup in court with Attorney Mary Margaret Hogan. Defendant Christian B. Greenup in custody. Attorney Elizabeth Constable appears for the state, along with Detective Travis Morgan. 

**********Morning Clerk is AZ**********

8:33 AM IN CHAMBERS: Off the record 
Court, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, Atty Hogan and Atty Constable present.
305Wis 2nd 695 and the Anderson case were referred to.
Court will give parties until 9:30 AM to research cases.

On the record in the Courtroom now:

9:43 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Purpose of this proceeding is to consider a note presented by the Jury this morning.

Court reads the note for the record, regarding number of contacts.

For the last 45 minutes, the parties had time to research, to respond to the note.

Atty Constable addresses the Court.
State refers to the Anderson case.

9:57 AM Atty Hogan addresses the Court, replies.

9:59 AM Court advises parties that another note has been presented to the Court.

Court addresses the parties regarding the first note written by the Jury.
BY THE COURT:
Court will reinstruct the Jury and read 21.07, 948.025, and include the definition of sexual intercourse.  

10:05 AM Court reads second note, regarding transcript. There is no transcript available today.

BY THE COURT:
Court will answer, no a transcript will not be available today.

10:10 AM Jurors enter the courtroom.

Court thanks Jurors for their continued patience.

Court has decided on a response to the first note this morning.

10:11 AM Court responds to the first note, for the record. Section 948.025 is addressed. 

10:14 AM Court responds to the second note in writing. Bailiff will give response once Jurors return to the Jury Room.

10:15 AM Jurors exit the courtroom.

Court will provide the definition of sexual intercourse to the Jury.

10:16 AM Court is in recess.

1:21 PM Court is back in session.
Court has been informed there is a verdict in the case.

1:21 PM Jurors enter the Courtroom.

1:23 PM Foreperson hands the verdict forms to the Bailiff, who then hand to the Court.

Court addresses the parties regarding emotional display.

Court reads the verdict.

Jury finds the Defendant GUILTY as in Count 1 of amended information.
Jury finds the Defendant NOT GUILTY as in Count 2 of amended information.

Neither party wishes to poll the Jury.

1:25 PM Court thanks and excuses the Jurors. Jurors are free to leave and may now speak about this case with anyone they wish, if they choose to.

Atty Constable moves the Court to find the Defendant guilty based on the Jury.

BY THE COURT:
Court orders Clerk to file the special verdict, as verdict of the Court.
Court orders Clerk to enter Judgment of Conviction on Count 1.
Court orders Clerk to dismiss Count 2.

Defendant's custody is remanded to the Sheriff pending further order of the Court.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is Revoked.

Court will schedule a sentencing hearing later.

BY THE COURT:
Court orders a PSI.

Parties are to discuss a hearing date with the Judicial Assistant.

1:28 PM Court is in recess.
Juror notes/questions

And exhibit's:
  P#1 - CD of Victim
  P#2 - Child Protection Center Female Body Form 2 sheets - (sealed)
Special Verdict

Day 2 of Jury Trial:
Defendant Christian B. Greenup in court with Attorney Mary Margaret Hogan. Defendant Christian B. Greenup in custody. Attorney Elizabeth Constable appears for the state, along with Detective Travis Morgan. 

**********Morning Clerk is AZ**********

(Exhibit #1 was offered and received prior to being published yesterday)

9:02 AM Court is in session.
One juror is missing and the Defendant is not present at the moment.
Court will resume after Defendant is present.

9:09 AM Court is back on the record.
Jury is not in the courtroom yet.
Court is ready to begin testimony this morning.

Atty Constable addresses the Court regarding a concern about a Defense exhibit. Atty Constable objects to the exhibits the defense is presented because of not knowing what they are.

Atty Hogan addresses the Court regarding a poster board (burden of proof), would not be marked as an exhibit but only to be used during closing argument.

Atty Constable addresses the Court, objects to this poster board for reasons stated on the record.

Atty Hogan addresses the Court, does not intend to mark the second poster board (reasonable doubt), is simply a demonstrative piece of evidence.

BY THE COURT:
Court requires that if Defense intends to use the demonstrative aid, to let the State use it as well. It is not evidence, it simply takes place of a hand written board or notes that the jury from which argument can be made. There is no indication in the brief time that it is misleading in any way.  As long as thte demostrative piece is available to both sides, Court will allow Defense to use it in the closing arguments.

Atty Hogan addresses the Court regarding cross-examination.

Atty Constable states the child will be available to be back on the stand. Atty Constable requests that victim witness coordinator be able to stand next to victim.  

BY THE COURT:
Court will allow victim witness coordinator to stand by victim.

9:18 AM Jurors return to the Courtroom. All 13 jurors are present in the courtroom.

Court addresses Jurors. Evidence will be completed today then a break will be taken to discuss instructions. Closing statements will be given then the Jury will be given the law and deliberations will begin.

9:19 AM J.A.Y. is re-called to the stand, is called and sworn in.
Cross examination by Atty Hogan. (Victim Witness Coordinator is standing near victim)
9:29 AM Re-direct by Atty Constable.

9:35 AM Victim is released for her subpoena.

9:37 AM Jacqueline Gremler is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Constable.
9:59 AM Cross-examination by Atty Hogan.
10:05 AM Re-direct by Atty Constable.
Exhibit #2 is referred to.
Exhibit #2 is offered and received.

10:10 AM State has no further witnesses. All exhibits presented have been entered into evidence. State rests.

10:11 AM Atty Hogan is prepared to proceed.

10:12 AM Sara Lane is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Hogan.
10:19 AM Cross-examination by Atty Constable.
10:27 AM Witness requests a break, is given some water.
10:28 AM Cross-examination continues.
10:29 AM Re-direct by Atty Hogan.
10:31 AM Witness is released from her subpoena.

10:32 AM Sidebar is taken at this time.

10:33 AM Court will take a 10 minute recess.
Court reminds Jurors to not discuss the case.

10:34 AM Court has been advised by Atty Hogan whether to testify or not at this trial.
Court addresses constitutional rights of testifying or not testifying.
Court questions Defendant as to his right to testify.
Defendant has made the decision, does not know, makes him feel uncomfortable and not at ease, can give it a shot though.  
Court clarifies.
Defendant states it is his decision to testify and will provide testimony at this trial.
Court questions Atty Hogan regarding Defendant's decision.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds Defendant has made decision knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.

10:37 AM Court is in a brief recess.

10:50 AM Court is back in session.
Atty Constable addresses the Court, reminding Defense as to previous convictions, correct answer is 7.
Court refers to the stipulation  that was filed yesterday as to prior convictions.

10:53 AM Jurors return to the Courtroom.

10:54 AM Christian Greenup is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Hogan.
11:00 AM Cross-examination by Atty Constable.
11:16 AM Re-direct by Atty Hogan.
11:17 AM Re-cross by Atty Constable.

11:18 AM Defense has no further witnesses.
Defense rests.

State has a rebuttle witness. Atty Constable confers with Victim Witness Coordinator for a moment.

11:20 AM Ben Janssen is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Constable.
11:25 AM Cross-examination by Atty Hogan.
11:26 AM Re-direct by Atty Constable.

11:27 AM Dino Sciortino is re-called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Constable.

11:32 AM State rests, there is no further rebuttle.

11:33 AM Court will excuse the Jurors at this time, to return at 1:00 pm. 
Court reminds Jurors to not discuss case with anyone.

11:34 AM Atty Hogan addresses the Court regarding instruction 305.
Atty Constable addresses the Court regarding this instruction.

11:36 AM Court is in recess until 1 PM.
Parties are to meet in chambers at 12:30 PM to go over instructions.

All exhibits are accounted for.

**********Afternoon Clerk is KS**********

2:04 p.m.  Court is back in session outside the presence of the jury. 
Court and both counsel discussed jury instructions in chambers. 
No objections by either party. 
Court makes statements re: instructions. 

2:05 p.m.  Jurors are escorted to the Courtroom. 
2:07 p.m.  Court reads instructions to the jury. 

2:23 p.m  Atty Constable makes closing arguments to the Court. 
2:40 p.m.  Atty Hogan makes closing arguments to the Court. 
2:48 p.m.  Atty Constable makes rebuttal arguments to the Court. 
2:58 p.m.  Court reads verdicts to the jury. 

3:02 p.m.  Juror #1277 is excused from service.  

3:03 p.m.  Clerk administers Oath of Officers. 
Jury is escorted from the Courtroom to begin deliberations. 

IN CHAMBERS: (Court clerks not present, court reporter reads proceedings to create these minutes.)
Atty Constable and Atty Hogan are present with the Court and Court Reporter. 
Court has received a note from the jury.   Reads the note for the parties. 
Atty Constable makes statements to the Court. 
Court questions Atty Constable. 
Atty Hogan makes statements to the Court. 
Court advises the bailiff of procedure for Exhibit #2. 
Atty Constable makes additional statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  Exhibit #2 is given to the jury and will be advised not to mutilate the exhibit in any way.  

3:32 p.m.  Court recesses. 

4:14 p.m.  IN CHAMBERS: 
Atty Constable, Atty Hogan, Clerk, Court and Court Reporter are present.  
Court has received a second note from the jury and reads that for the parties. 
Atty Hogan makes arguments to the Court. 
Atty Constable makes arguments to the Court. 
Atty Hogan makes additional arguments to the Court. 
Atty Constable makes additional arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  For reasons stated on the record, Court will not allow the video to be viewed in its entirety.  Only the 1st portion of the DVD will be played at appropriate speed and volume. 

Court questions parties re: when to play the video, tonight or tomorrow morning. 
Atty Constable makes statements to the Court. 
Atty Hogan makes statements to the Court. 

Court will bring the jury to the courtroom to have the video played. 

4:45 p.m. IN THE COURTROOM:
Appearances:  Atty Constable and Detective Morgan, Atty Hogan and the Defendant. 
Jurors are escorted to the Courtroom. 
Court addresses the jury.  Due to some technical difficulty earlier, the Court will replay the first 13 minutes and 51 seconds of the interview at the ordinary speed and volume.

4:52 p.m.  Video is played from 0 to 13:52.  
5:05 p.m.  Court advises the jury that they will continue tomorrow morning. 
Jury asks to begin at 8:00 a.m.  

5:07 p.m. Court is in recess.

Day 1 of Jury Trial:
Defendant Christian B. Greenup in court with Attorney Mary Margaret Hogan. Defendant Christian B. Greenup in custody. Attorney Elizabeth Constable appears for the state, along with Detective Travis Morgan. 

**********Morning Clerk is JB**********
8:40 am Motions in Limine were addressed in chambers.

Amended Information is filed and reading is waived.  Count 2 is amended.

Exhibits #1-3 are marked on behalf of the plaintiff before Court.

9:19 am Court welcomes jurors and introduces the parties.

9:24 am Clerk administers Voir Dire Oath.  Clerk calls 23 jurors to be seated.
9:29 am Court administers Voir Dire.
9:57 am Atty Constable administers Voir Dire.
10:32 am Atty Hogan administers Voir Dire.
10:42 am Parties exercise their peremptory strikes.
The following 13 jurors have been chosen:
Juror #1172, 1179, 1195, 1204, 1220, 1225, 1226, 1235, 1238, 1277, 1283, 1297, and 1303.
10:53 am Court thanks the jurors who have not been chosen and excuses them.
10:54 am Clerk administers Jurors Oath.
10:55 am Court gives opening instructions to the jurors.
11:00 am Court is in recess for 15 minutes.

11:01 am Atty Constable moves for a sequestion order.
Atty Hogan agrees.

BY THE COURT:
Motion is granted.

11:26 am Court is back in session.
11:27 am Jurors are escorted into the courtroom.
11:29 am Court gives preliminary instructions to the jurors.
11:30 am Atty Constable makes opening statements.
11:35 am Atty Hogan makes opening statements.

11:44 am A. Caravajol is called and sworn in.
Direct exam by Atty Constable.
11:50 am Cross exam by Atty Hogan.
11:51 am Re-direct exam by Atty Constable.
11:52 am Re-cross exam by Atty Hogan.
Witness is excused.

11:53 am D. Sciortino is called and sworn in. 
Direct exam by Atty Constable.
11:57 am Cross exam by Atty Hogan.
Witness is excused.

11:59 am Atty Constable asks for a hearing without the jurors present.
Jurors are escorted out of the courtroom.

Atty Constable motions for admissibility of defendant statements.
Atty Hogan objects and states objections - hearsay.

BY THE COURT:
Court is unable to make preliminary determination.
Atty Constable makes additional statements.
Court denies the motion.
Atty Constable asks to take proof of testimony.

12:05 pm Detective Morgan is called and sworn in.
Direct exam by Atty Constable.
12:09 pm Atty Hogan makes statements.

BY THE COURT:
Court denies the motion.

12:12 pm Jurors are escorted back into the courtroom.
12:14 pm Direct exam continues.
Witness identifies defendant.
12:25 pm Cross exam by Atty Hogan.
12:32 pm Re-direct exam by Atty Constable.
Witness is excused.

12:36 pm Court excuses jurors for lunch.  Court to resume at 1:30 pm.


**********Afternoon Clerk is AN**********
1:50 pm. Court is back in session.
Court is considering State's motion to allow Ms. Iwanski, Victim Witness Coordinator, to sit with the witness while the witness testifies.
Defense objects to the motion.

BY THE COURT:
Court grants motion. Court imposes restriction that Ms. Iwanski may not speak to the witness during the testimony and may not touch the witness.

Court questions parties if it is necessary that the Court Reporter take full transcription of the video.
State indicates that she will provide a transcript for the record if it is necessary.
Defense agrees.
1:59 pm. Jurors are escorted back into the courtroom.
J.A.Y. called and sworn in.
Direct exam by Atty Constable.
Exhibit #1 reffered to.
State requests to publish the video.
No objection.
Witness J.A.Y. is excused at this time but will need to be available for cross examination after the video is published.
2:07 pm. Video is published.
2:19 pm. State asks to stop the video to adjust the speed of it.
3:40 pm. Video is finished.
Atty Constable indicates that she needs to take one of her witnesses today.
Court indicates that that witness will be taken next out of order.
3:43 pm. Court is in recess.

3:57 pm. Court is back in session.
Atty Hogan indicates that she objects to the victim coming in again tomorrow.
Atty Constable indicates that she wishes to proceed by calling her witness out of order.

BY THE COURT:
Court denies the defense motion.
 
4:02 pm. Jurors are escorted back into the courtroom.
Witness Dr. K. Iniguez called and sworn in.
Direct exam by Atty Constable.
Cross exam by Atty Hogan.
Redirect by Atty Constable.
Recross by Atty Hogan.
Witness is excused from her subpoena.
4:26 pm. Court cautions Jurors about discussing the case.
Jurors are excused and are to return to the courthouse by 9:00 am tomorrow 2-25-16.

Defendant Christian B. Greenup in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan. Defendant Christian B. Greenup in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Set for motion hearing's today - Motion to Modify Bond and Continue Jury Trial and Motion for Reconsideration of State's Motion to Permit Child Victim to Testify Live via Audio-Visual Means from Adjacent Courtroom.

8:39 a.m.  Court  calls case and states the appearances.
Court has received and Amended Motions in Limine as of 02/22/16 and the Motion for Reconsideration of State's Motion to Permit Child Victim to Testify Live via Audio-Visual Means from Adjacent Courtroom.
Court will proceed with the State's motion to continue the trial.
Atty Hogan opposes the motion for continuation.
Atty Constable makes statements regarding her motion of continuation and the motion for reconsideration and makes statements on the record.
Atty Constable cites case law(s) on the record.
Court questions Atty Constable; Atty Constable responds.
Atty Hogan responds to the and states her objection on the motion for continuance/bond modification and states her reasons on the record.
Court questions Atty Hogan regarding the revocation issue (on another matter); she responds to this question.
Atty Constable responds to the revocation of the defendant on this other matter.
Court makes additional statements in re:  the revocation; Atty Constable responds.
Court indicates it needs to know if it can stay the revocation proceedings on the other case pending the jury trial.
Court cannot rule on this motion until it is known if the revocation proceedings can be stayed.
Both parties are to meet with the probation officer and get this information figured out.

BY THE COURT: 
Court is continued until 10:30 a.m.  

10:33 a.m.  Court is back in session and appearances remain the same.
Atty Constable indicates that Mr Linjer is present in the courtroom today.
10:34 a.m.  Mr Linger is sworn in.
Court questions Mr Linger. 
10:36 a.m.  Mr Linger is excused from the witness stand.
Court has reviewed the statute during break and reads it to counsel.
Court makes additional statements to the parties

BY THE COURT:
Motion for Continuance is DENIED.
Motion for Reconsideration to be heard first thing in the morning on February 24, 2016 as will the Motions in Limine.  

Atty Constable will be filing an additional motion.
Atty Hogan has no response and would like to continue with the Trial.
Atty Constable makes additional statements regarding the emotional benefit of the child involved.

Motion hearing at 02-18-2016 10:30 am

Attorney  Mary Margaret Hogan appeared by phone for Defendant Christian B. Greenup. Prosecuting Atty Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Christian B. Greenup in court. Defendant in custody.

3:08 PM Court calls case.
Atty Hogan appears by telephone.
Court states appearances.

Matter is set for motions this afternoon.

Atty Constable addresses the Court, has concerns regarding Atty Hogan appearing by phone, for reasons stated on the record.  Atty Constable has a concern attempting to proceed which has become unique and requests JT be adjourned for reasons stated on the record.  

Atty Hogan addresses the Court, a speedy trial demand has been filed. Atty Hogan objects to any kind of adjournment for reasons stated on the record.

Court is ready to proceed.  If parties are not ready to proceed, then something else has to be done.

Atty Constable is not prepared today, having a motion filed late Friday, to discuss motion.  
Atty Hogan addresses the Court, filed the expert witness list and psychological evaluation, is not sure why State is not prepared to proceed.

Court has received Atty Hogan's motion this morning.  Court has read the motion, the report. 

Court addresses the parties, the evidentary motions are important to both parties.  Motions needs to be resolved. 

Parties continue discussions.

Court reviews State vs. Davis 254 Wis 2nd 1, 2002 Supreme Court decision.

Atty Constable addresses the Court, states concerns.
Atty Hogan replies, there needs to be a ruling on the motion first. 

Court is prepared to rule on the motion.

Atty Constable is prepared to proceed on the State's motion, addresses this motion, requests the Court to bar the psychiatric motion.
Atty Hogan addresses the Court.

Court believes both parties are right.  Court addresses the parties.

BY THE COURT:
State's motion is granted.
Defense's motion is granted.

Atty Constable addresses the Court.  
Court would like to see some written basis for the motion to support the motion in writing.

It will be the Court's intention to hear the motion as soon as it can be filed. If Court grants motion, there will be time issues. 

Atty Hogan addresses the Court regarding filing a response on a State's motion. 
Atty Constable addresses the Court, has filed motions in limine.
State can make time on her calendar to continue this hearing tomorrow or Wednesday. 

Court has not seen Atty Hogan's filing.

Atty Hogan will send response to the Court.


  Motion hearing scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 10:30 am.
